metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6619 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The default configuration for MongoDB before 2.3.2 does not validate objects, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (crash) or read system memory via a crafted BSON object in the column name in an insert command, which triggers a buffer over-read.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mongodb - 1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1
mongodb-clients - 1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1
mongodb-server - 1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1
mongodb-server-core - 1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mongodb package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1').
